title: Ask HN: How do you choose your usernames?
text:
Basically the title. Every time I want to sign up for websites, the hardest and most time consuming part is choosing the username. I just never got why some people add seemingly random numbers in the end. I've always wanted the username to mean something or be special in a way. There have been times when I spent almost half an hour trying to come up with a better username, esp. on websites that don't allow you to change the username in the future.

How do you come up with your usernames? And is it really important in this day and age?

See this for example: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5742175/

title: Trading algo visual debugging tool
Ask HN: Should We Embrace OpenAI/ChatGPT for Everything?
text:
Over the past 12 months, OpenAI has made me a 10x engineer; I can do tasks 10x faster than I would before. With that being said, this is a terrifying behavior meaning that previously I could have hired nine other people (realistically one or two) to do what OpenAI helped me do at the same speed; this brings me to my next point.

Should you give OpenAI access to data that one or two employees would have gotten to perform their tasks? Am I potentially helping train the AI to destroy my company in the future? Or should I build my models using our large dataset and some data from OpenAI?

Extra context: some data could include tracked customer behaviors, past resolutions, and results.

Ask HN: Alternatives to Google Analytics in 2023
text:
I have a Flask site hosted on Linux with Nginx and gunicorn. It is a site to catalogue development of Bonsai trees, so not ecommerce.

I would like to see visitor numbers at times of day and probably a few more things in the future. In the past I would have stuck Google Analytics on and got on with my day. Now I want to avoid the cookie banner, and the shitty tracking of my users. I don't want to code analytics, I want to work on features. It feels like my nginx logs have the data I need. Is there a simple tool that analyses this? Or should I just find a less crappy front end analytics service?.

What is everyone using in 2023?

The site is at Bonsai-garden.com just so you can imagine what I am going to need.
